lines.text:
[to Lester]
I haven't even got my lipstick on! A woman has to wear lipstick. I'd feel positively naked without it!
[after being rejected for a romantic role because of his looks]

Miss Hudson, in your own native city of San Francisco, there's an art gallery in the Legion of Honor in which there's an oil painting of Casanova. It's quite obvious that you have never seen this painting. For your information, Miss Hudson, this is what Casanova looked like. He had big ears, a scar over one eye, a broken nose, and a wart on his chin, right here. I suggest, Miss Hudson, that when you return to San Francisco, you visit this gallery and see this painting!
Remember what Nietzsche says "Live dangerously!"
You know what happened to Nietzsche?
No, what?
He's dead.
I like to look at you.
You couldn't possibly at this hour of the morning.
Oh, anyone can look at you in the afternoon.
But I haven't even got my lipstick on! A woman has to wear lipstick. I feel positively naked without it.

[Stopping short when he sees the drop alongside the staeps of the summer house]
Whoa...!
What's the matter, Darling?

[Frightened]
It's a precipice!

[laughs]
I've been running up and down these steps ever since I was twelve.
Don't you ever do it again!
Live dangerously!
You know what happened to Nietzsche?
What?
He's dead!
[laughs]
I was just wondering what I'd done to deserve you
Why are you looking at me like that?

[Ambiguously]
I was jusy wondering what I've done to deserve you.
Welcome to my home, Lester.
It's quite a cozy home.
Cozy enough to take your coat off?
Delighted.
